entries.name: Hydrazine
entries.description: A toxic, efficient monopropellant for small thrusters. Dense and stable for long-term storage.

entries.name: Methalox
entries.description: A high-performance, clean-burning bipropellant (Methane/LOX). Good balance of density and performance.

entries.name: Liquid Hydrogen
entries.description: Extremely high-efficiency propellant, but its incredibly low density requires massive, cryogenic tanks.

entries.name: Xenon (Liquid)
entries.description: An inert, heavy propellant for ion drives. Stored as a high-pressure liquid, making it very dense.

entries.name: Fusion Pellets (D-T)
entries.description: Hyper-compressed Deuterium-Tritium pellets for a fusion torch. Incredibly dense energy source.

entries.name: Antihydrogen (Solid)
entries.description: The ultimate propellant. Extremely low density, but its energy release is total. Requires massive magnetic containment.

entries.name: Exotic Matter
entries.description: A substance with non-Newtonian properties, required to generate a 'warp' bubble. Density is a placeholder.
